title: Linux zdump Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux zdump command, which displays time zone information. Learn its syntax, understand timezone data, and see practical examples of its usage.

meta.title: Linux zdump Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux zdump command, which displays time zone information. Learn its syntax, understand timezone data, and see practical examples of its usage.
meta.keywords: Linux, zdump, timezone, time zone, system configuration, system settings

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Syntax of the zdump Command

verify.name: Verify the zdump command output
verify.hint: The output of the `zdump` command should include the "isdst=" field, which indicates the daylight saving time status. Please check the output and try again.

steps.title: Explore Timezone Information Using the zdump Command

verify.name: Verify the zdump command output for multiple timezones
verify.hint: The output of the `zdump` command should include the times for the "America/New_York", "Europe/London", and "Asia/Tokyo" timezones. Please check the output and try again.

steps.title: Practical Examples of Using the zdump Command

verify.name: Verify the zdump command output for timezone difference
verify.hint: The output of the `zdump` command should include the times for the "America/New_York" and "Asia/Tokyo" timezones, as well as the time difference between them (EDT and JST). Please check the output and try again.
